Class AVLPlayerNode

java.lang.Object
AVLPlayerNode
public class AVLPlayerNode extends Object

AVLPlayerNode. Node that creates an AVL self-balancing tree with special functionality like scoreboard() to be used with ScoreKeeper.java.

Known bugs: delete() doesn't change balance factors and thus insertions do not work after a delete (only required for extra credit)

Author:

Viridia Weiss

gweiss@brandeis.edu

November 13, 2022

COSI 21A PA2

  • Method Details

    • insert

      public AVLPlayerNode insert(Player newGuy, double value)
      Insertion function. This makes sure to update the balance factor and right weight and uses rotations to maintain AVL condition. Runtime is O(log(n))
      Parameters:
      newGuy - new player for node
      value - value stored alongside player (ELO or ID)
      Returns:
      the new root of the tree

    • balanceFactor

      private void balanceFactor()
      Recursive balanceFactor update function for insert(). Runtime is O(log(n))

    • balanceFactorReversed

      private void balanceFactorReversed()
      Recursive balanceFactor update function for autoBalance(). Runtime is O(log(n))

    • autoBalance

      private AVLPlayerNode autoBalance()
      Function that handles DoubleLeft and DoubleRight rotations, maintaining BF and RW. Runtime is O(log(n))
      Returns:
      root of the new tree

    • delete

      public AVLPlayerNode delete(double value)
      Deletion function. Runtime is O(log(n))
      Parameters:
      value - the value of the node to be deleted
      Returns:
      the new root of the tree

    • delete_node

      private AVLPlayerNode delete_node()

    • treeSuccessor

      private AVLPlayerNode treeSuccessor()

    • shiftNodes

      private void shiftNodes(AVLPlayerNode v)

    • rotateRight

      private void rotateRight()
      Right rotation based on pseudocode. Handles left and right weights. O(1)

    • rotateLeft

      private void rotateLeft()
      Right rotation based on pseudocode. Handles left and right weights. O(1)

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer(double value)
      Runtime is O(log(n))
      Parameters:
      value - the node to check
      Returns:
      the Player object stored in the node with this.value == value

    • getRank

      public int getRank(double value)
      Function to get the rank of a given node using binary search. Runtime is O(log(n))
      Parameters:
      value -
      Returns:
      the rank of the node with this.value == value

    • treeString

      public String treeString()
      Returns:
      the tree of names with parentheses separating subtrees eg "((bob)alice(bill))". Runtime is O(n)

    • treeString_debug

      public String treeString_debug()
      Returns:
      the tree of names with parentheses separating subtrees eg "((bob)alice(bill))" but with the balancefactor printed for debugging purposes. Runtime is O(n)

    • scoreboard_loop

      public String scoreboard_loop()
      fencepost error prevention function. Runtime is O(n)
      Returns:
      a formatted scoreboard in descending order of value

    • scoreboard

      public String scoreboard()
      Scoreboard generator. Runtime is O(n)
      Returns:
      the top line of the scoreboard plus the formatted scoreboard generated by scoreboard_loop()
